review_title: Excellent Mission, Values, and Place to Work
pros: Carlow University embodies their mission and core values of service to those in need and providing educational opportunities to those who may not otherwise obtain them.  I am proud to be a part of this growing tradition.
cons: As a smaller University, sometimes you will have your hands in many different functions and it can stretch you.  However, this does give you an opportunity to make real, meaningful contributions.

pros: Tuition reimbursement is phenomenal.  The clientele are good and the staff are highly qualified. The work is never boring and you have autonomy in your classroom.
cons:
have to pay for parking. 
Continuity of care can be difficult if you have an infant to toddler age you are not fond of.  Works great if you are a consistent teacher with clear expectations- creates a great classroom environment where you can build on your successes the previous year. 
NAEYC portfolio upkeep is time consuming.

pros:
Dedicated employees
Handicapped accessible 
Rich history of Sisters of Mercy
cons:
High turnover throughout entire univeristy.
Salary scales not present and salary freezes are often.
People are walked out often and given no reason - no due process at all.  
Seniority does not matter. Some people walked out after 30 years. 
Parking and health benefits increase more than salaries, so your net income is constantly moving backwards.

pros:
Coworkers are friendly and campus is welcoming. Community is based in mercy values
Perks include free parking in the summer and decent amount of time off during Christmas
cons:
Severely understaffed and low pay are common complaints for all areas of the University. 
High turnover thwarts the campus from moving forward. 
Most areas are operating in antiquated ways and the culture is a bit conservative.

pros: A sense of community if you get involved. Community outreach. Service oriented. Flexibility. It's hard to leave because of the friendships you develop.
cons: Salaries are not competitive. Many employees under 28,000 yr. No professional development for growth opportunities.

review_title: A Gateway To Success For Students
pros: Opportunity to teach great students. Supportive Colleagues. Great location.
cons: Full time teachers are expected to teach four courses a semester.

pros: Great work life balance; wonderful colleagues
cons: Constant changes is management and confusing often unpredictable policy changes
